result.title: European Advisory Board meetings
result.description: The European Advisory Board (EAB) provides experience, advice and feedback on the standardisation of EES and investments. There will be 3 half-day D1.7 European advisory board meetings (M29) which require coordination, preparation and moderation. Broad consensus will be sought within the EAB on the guidelines (WP3) and certification frameworks (WP5). Members of the EAB consist of (1) Standardisation experts: CENELEC, CEN – European Committee for Standardization and (NEN - Standardization institute of the Netherlands); Financial experts: SUSI Partners and IFC (World Bank Group); Energy service providers: EFIEES and SIEMENS; Project facilitator: Econoler; chaired by Mr. Jan W Bleyl, chair of the IEA-DSM Task Force 16. The EAB members are also involved in the EEFIG initiative and, hence, will be informed of with the latest discussions. All EAB members have provided letters of support. In addition to the EAB members, only WP leaders and EFIEES will participate in EAB meetings.

result.title: European and national websites
result.description: D6.2 European and national websites (M06) will be created based on the graphic toolkit (D6.1). The website will be important for disseminating, marketing and promoting the results of the project to the stakeholders and target groups. There will be European webpages maintained by the WP leader. For all partners national webpages will be created where the national partner will be responsible for the content and will have full rights to change the content. The content will be partly translation (or a copy) of the European webpages and partly own national content. The website will be regularly updated and will include background information, support, relevant key messages and outputs of the project. The energy efficiency services market and quality database (Task 2.3) will be incorporated into the QualitEE webpage. The database shall offer intuitive data navigation and synthesis.

result.title: Webinars on EEM label
result.description: To ensure a large outreach and impact three webinars bringing together 1520 participants will be hold held to provide information and guidance on the EEM label to relevant stakeholders The first webinar will be focussed on onboarding Nordic banks the second webinar will provide guidance on implementing the Labels Harmonised Disclosure Template HDT and the third webinar will focus on followup questions and troubleshooting where necessary
